oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Hank Williams - Louisiana Hayride final appearance
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: First recording is part two of the complete audio recording from the film The Girl From Tobacco Row, created by Tex Ritter and released in 1966. Second record contains Hank Williams final performance on radio program Louisiana Hayride, on radio station KWKH (Radio station : Shreveport, La.), a recording of Hank Williams apologizing from his sick bed for a no show in Washington D.C. in January of 1952, and a sort speech by Hank Williams, in which he endorses Neil McCormack for Sheriff in Florida.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Hank Williams
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Softly And Tenderly [from film sound] -- [Dialogue from film] -- Fortunes In Memories (Gordon Terry) [from film sound] -- [Dialogue from film] -- I'm Ragged But I'm Right (Snake Richards) [from film sound] -- [Dialogue from film] -- [Unidentified fiddle tune] (Fiddlin' Arthur Smith) [from film sound] -- [Dialogue from film] -- Hank Williams talks and introduces the next tune -- Jambalaya (On The Bayou) (Hank Williams) -- Hank Williams talks and apologizes for being unable to appear in Washington D.C. because he had surgery -- Hank Williams endorses Neil McCormack for sheriff in Florida -- Hank Williams talks (incomplete)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Ritter, Tex, 1905-1974; Faye, Rita, 1944-; Emery, Ralph; Terry, Gordon; Carson, Martha; Wilson, Smiley; Wilson, Kitty; Smith, Arthur, 1898-1971; Mountaineers (Musical group : Hal Lone Pine); KWKH (Radio station : Shreveport, La.); Louisiana hayride (Radio program); Williams, Hank, 1923-1953;
